Authors:
Kevin D. Hyde, E.B. Gareth Jones, Mingkhuan Doilom, Mark
Seasat Calabon, Chun-Fang Liao, Saranyaphat Boonmee
Title:
Placement of Mycoenterolobium in Testudinaceae (Pleosporales)
and de-scription of M. aquadictyosporium sp. nov.
Keywords:
1 new taxon, freshwater hyphomycete, Asian mycology,
multigene analysis, Thailand
Abstract:
A study of freshwater fungi in Thailand led to the
discovery of Mycoenterolobium aquadicty-osporium sp. nov. Evidence for
the novelty and placement in Mycoenterolobium is based on comparison of
morphological data. The new species differs from the type species, M.
plat-ysporum, in having shorter and wider conidia, and from M.
flabelliforme in having much larg-er and wider conidia. The
hyphomycetous genus Mycoenterolobium is similar to Cancellidi-um, but
differs in the arrangement of conidial rows of cells at the attachment
point to the co-nidiophores. The conidia of the former are made up of
rows of cells, radiating in a linear pat-tern from a single cell
attached to the conidiophore, while in Cancellidium adherent rows of
septate branches radiating from the conidiophore. Cancellidium conidia
also contain branched chains of blastic monilioid cells arising from the
conidia, while these are lacking in Mycoen-terolobium. At maturity in
Mycoenterolobium the two conidial lobes unite and are closely
ap-pressed. The present study provides DNA sequence data for
Mycoenterolobium aquadicty-osporium and based on the multigene
phylogenetic analysis, the species clusters within Testu-dinaceae
(Pleosporales, Dothideomycetes).
